channel.title: People on Quantitative Data Analytics
channel.description: Recent content in People on Quantitative Data Analytics

item.title: Assistant Professor
item.description: I’m interested in deep reinforcement learning, particularly in the aspects related to generalization from limited data and how it is possible to integrate model-based and model-free learning. One of my recent works (AAAI-19) describes how both the model-based and model-free approaches can be integrated via a shared low-dimensional learned encoding of the environment that captures summarizing abstractions. With a particular focus on generalization, I also wrote an introduction to deep reinforcement learning (Foundations and Trends in Machine Learning) as well as a paper providing theoretical insights on bias and overfitting in the general context of POMDPs (JAIR).

item.title: Full Professor
item.description: Location 10A-87 of the NU.VU building Address Dr. Mark Hoogendoorn Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam Faculty of Science Department of Computer Science De Boelelaan 1111 1081 HV Amsterdam The Netherlands

item.title: PhD Student
item.description: Jan Klein is a PhD student in the Stochastics group of the Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI). He is under the supervision of prof. dr. Rob van der Mei (Stochastics, CWI), prof. dr. Sandjai Bhulai (Analytics & Optimization, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU)) and dr. Mark Hoogendoorn (Quantitative Data Analytics, VU). Jan’s research is in collaboration with the Dutch Ministry of the Interior and Kingdom Relations and focuses on anomaly detection in primarily the field of cybersecurity.

item.title: PhD student
item.description: Floris den Hengst is a PhD. student in the Quantitative Data Analytics and Knowledge Representation and Reasoning groups of the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.

item.title: PhD student
item.description: Luis is a PhD student at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, working in the Quantitative Data Analytics group. His main research focus is in Deep Learning algorithms to sensorial data and time-series.

item.title: PhD student
item.description: Martin Haan is a medical doctor at the intensive care unit (ICU) of Amsterdam UMC location VUmc and started as a PhD student in March 2021 mainly working on the ICUdata-project, a collaboration by Dutch ICUs to engage in large scale data sharing on critically ill patients to improved quality of care and patient outcomes.

item.title: PhD student
item.description: Tariq Dam started in september 2020 as a PhD-student working on machine learning in the Intensive Care department as part or the Quantitative Data Analytics and Laboratory for Critical Care Computational Intelligence.

item.title: PhD. Student
item.description: My PhD project is a collaboration between the Computer Science department of the VU and the Obstetrics & Gynecology department of the Amsterdam UMC. The aim of the project is to investigate whether a machine learning model using electrohysterography (EHG), which is a noninvasive measurement of the uterine electrical activity, and standard clinical measurements can be used to predict premature labor. My project supervisors are prof. dr. Mark Hoogendoorn (Quantative Data Analytics, VU), dr.

item.title: PhD. Student
item.description: I am a 2nd year PhD Student at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam under supervision of Jakub Tomczak and Mark Hoogendoorn. My research is focused on the development of efficient deep learning architectures, particularly towards settings with scarce (labeled) data availability. To this end, I am specially interested in neural architectures involving (1) extensive parameter sharing (e.g. equivariant networks) and (2) attention mechanisms. My research is founded by the NWO as part of the Efficient Deep Learning project.

item.title: PhD. student
item.description: I am a Ph.D. candidate in the Computational Intelligence group at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU) and in Mobiquity’s Data Science and Analytics team. I’m interested in data efficient (Deep) Reinforcement Learning (RL) applied to real-world problems. To achieve this I’ve developed a simulator for daily human behavior/activities powered by generative models (GANs) and recurrent neural networks (LSTMs). The simulator is used as a testbed for novel data efficient RL algorithms.

item.title: PhD. student
item.description: Lucas Fleuren is a PhD student and medical doctor in the intensive care unit of Amsterdam UMC lcoation VUmc working on building large-scale ICU datasets, developing clinically useful AI models, and bringing AI solutions to the bedside to improve patient outcomes

item.title: PhD. student
item.description: Olivier Moulin is a PhD student in the Quantitative Data Analytics group of the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU). He is under the supervision of Mark Hoogendoorn (Quantitative Data Analytics, VU). Olivier’s PhD research is mainly on Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning on structured data applied to ICU patient data.

item.title: Postdoc
item.description: Frank Bennis started in September 2020 as a postdoctoral researcher in the Quantitative Data Analytics group under supervision of dr. Mark Hoogendoorn. He focuses on the identification of parameters and subsequently the prediction of Sudden Cardiac Death in patients based on general practicioner (GP) data. He furthermore collaborates with the Nederlands Instituut voor Onderzoek van de Gezondheidszorg for the prediction of multiple cardiac diseases from GP data. With his background in Technical Medicine, he aims to establish the connection between data science and medicine.

item.title: Postdoctoral Researcher
item.description: My areas of education is computer science, artificial intelligence, and robotic. My research mainly focuses on sequential decision making and reinforcement learning in multi-agent systems, where uncertainties, partial observations and multiple actors are the main challenges in such systems. Currently I am working on Deep Reinforcement Learning for Critical Decision Making on Covid-19 patients. It is a joint research project at Amsterdam UMC Intensive Care Unit and QDA group of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.
